column4: Ubuntu is still not the best server OS imho, but it does work as one. :)
exim4 is *one* mailer daemon... quite good one imho.
But not the best according to most people.
Sure lilubu.
in what way isn't it?
Not a server OS?
yes
Well the default install (and there's only that) installs an X and many X apps, right? I'm not sure if I want to fill up my HD with that...
no, you can do a custom install that doesn't install them
Why not install backports?
because they're very poorly made
some people have a genetic propensity to require cvs snapshots of everything
Yeah, I know a couple of those... but those I know are the ones who can cope with it. :P
running debian stable?
with security updates?
No, testing... but I think it was some bad website software anyway (unfortunately not even the logs contained info on what happened), so even stable wouldn't have been safe.
ah
well, cracked php stuff should only let someone get www-data, which doesn't help much
Exactly, I love Unix security... they were trying to hack the root account when I noticed... and www-run was running some weird software like an FTPd.
Yeah, I know some people too... I got awstats as well, but only accessible from the Intranet.
gnome-volume-manager
Was that last directed to me? :o
